page.title: 07TRANSPORT - DUNDEE WEST
page.content: { ROADS:}Three major road schemes are transforming this area of Dundee: { The University Bypass}is the new arterial route along the former Hawkhill to supercede the Perth Road as an access route from the West to the city centre. { The Riverside Drive Extension}will at once by-pass Invergowrie village and join the Ring Road and national trunk routes to provide direct access to the Tay Road Bridge from the west. { The NW Radial Route}has only one fragment completed (around Lochee) and development is not imminent. { DUNDEE AIRFIELD. The length of the runway is 1100 metres; the largest plane in service is the Airspace 748.There are two flights daily to and from both London and Manchester ; each flight can take 40 passengers.
